faculty_info.name: Faculty of Artificial Intelligence and Cyber Security (FAIX)
faculty_info.dean: Associate Professor Ts. Dr. Muhammad Hafidz Fazli Bin Md Fauadi

vision_mission.vision: To be a leading faculty in producing skilled AI and cybersecurity professionals to meet Malaysia's goal of cultivating 200,000 AI specialists and 100,000 cyber security experts by 2030
vision_mission.mission: To advance education, research, and development of high-caliber professionals in AI and cyber security disciplines through innovation, industry collaboration, and future-ready curriculum
objectives: Develop solutions with tangible societal impact
Produce workforce equipped with necessary skills for technology leadership
Establish UTeM as a primary driver in AI and cybersecurity education

undergraduate.name: Bachelor of Computer Science (Artificial Intelligence) with Honours
graduate_attributes: Able to acquire and apply knowledge in computer science and information technology
Able to analyze, design and develop ICT applications
Can use artificial intelligence techniques when developing systems

undergraduate.name: Bachelor of Computer Science (Computer Security) with Honours

postgraduate.name: Master of Computer Science (Security Science)
postgraduate.focus: Advanced cybersecurity and security science research

postgraduate.name: Master of Technology (Data Science and Analytics)
postgraduate.focus: Data science, analytics, and big data technologies

postgraduate.name: Master of Technology in Data Science and Analytics (Open and Distance Learning - ODL)
postgraduate.focus: Flexible learning for working professionals in data science

requirements.description: International qualifications accepted subject to evaluation

undergraduate_international.learning_approach: 70% coursework and practical projects, emphasis on real-world applications

entry_requirements.requirement: Bachelor's degree (Level 6, MQF) in Computing or related fields with minimum CGPA of 2.50
Bachelor's degree (Level 6, MQF) in Computing or related fields with minimum CGPA of 2.00, subject to rigorous assessment
Bachelor's degree (Level 6, MQF) in Non-Computing field with minimum CGPA of 2.00, subject to assessment of working experience in Computing
Bachelor's degree (Level 6, MQF) in Non-Computing field with minimum CGPA of 2.00, with prerequisite courses required

language_requirements.alternative: Enroll in English proficiency courses if requirements not met

departments.name: Department of Intelligent Computing and Analytics
departments.focus: AI, machine learning, data analytics, and intelligent systems

key_highlights: Established in 2024 as part of Malaysia's Advanced TVET initiative
Aims to produce 200,000 AI specialists and 100,000 cybersecurity experts by 2030
Part of Malaysia's Technical University Network (MTUN)
Emphasis on practical learning (70% coursework, 30% hands-on projects)
Curriculum designed to stay ahead of evolving tech landscape
Strong industry collaboration and real-world application focus
Leading hub for AI and cybersecurity research in Malaysia

faqs.question: What programmes does FAIX offer?
faqs.answer: FAIX offers 2 undergraduate programmes (AI and Computer Security) and 3 postgraduate programmes (Security Science, Data Science and Analytics including ODL option).

faqs.question: When was FAIX established?
faqs.answer: FAIX was officially founded on July 22, 2024.

faqs.question: What are the career opportunities for AI graduates?
faqs.answer: AI graduates can pursue careers as knowledge engineers, smart systems developers, systems analysts, software developers, computer scientists, and researchers.

faqs.question: Does FAIX accept international students?
faqs.answer: Yes, FAIX welcomes international students and provides a diverse learning community with support for international applicants.

faqs.question: What is the learning approach at FAIX?
faqs.answer: FAIX emphasizes practical learning with 70% coursework and 30% hands-on, real-world projects to ensure industry readiness.

faqs.question: What are the postgraduate entry requirements?
faqs.answer: Requirements vary based on background: Computing graduates need minimum CGPA 2.50, non-computing graduates may need prerequisite courses. MUET Band 4 or CEFR Low B2 required.

faqs.question: How many staff members are at FAIX?
faqs.answer: FAIX has 25 academic staff and 5 administrative personnel.
